summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the in-person pretrial conference for the Ghislaine Maxwell case scheduled for November 1, 2021. It details the location, COVID-19 protocols, and arrangements for public and victim access to the proceeding.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this pretrial conference is being held.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this order scheduling the pretrial conference and outlining access protocols.

events.title: In-Person Pretrial Conference
events.description: A scheduled in-person pretrial conference for the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell, to be held in Courtroom 518.

locations: United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York
keyFacts: The court scheduled an in-person pretrial conference for November 1, 2021, in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The order ensures access for alleged victims and members of the defendant's family to the proceeding.
Due to COVID-19 protocols, the public could access the proceeding via live video/audio feeds in designated overflow courtrooms, with strict rules against electronic device use.
All courthouse visitors were required to complete a health questionnaire, have their temperature checked, and wear an approved mask.
